headline.main: Big Dutch Fund Dumps Wal-Mart and PetroChina

docs.snippet: The biggest pension fund in the Netherlands, Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds, said on Tuesday that it had divested its stakes in Wal-Mart Stores and PetroChina and blacklisted both companies in its portfolio, citing noncompliance with United Nat...

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: The biggest pension fund in the Netherlands, Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds, said on Tuesday that it had divested its stakes in Wal-Mart Stores and PetroChina and blacklisted both companies in its portfolio, citing noncompliance with United Nations human rights principles, according to MarketWatch.
docs.lead_paragraph: The biggest pension fund in the Netherlands, Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds, said on Tuesday that it had divested its stakes in Wal-Mart Stores and PetroChina and blacklisted both companies in its portfolio, citing noncompliance with United Nations human rights principles, according to MarketWatch. Read more »

docs.snippet: A look back at the Numberplay puzzles of 2011....
docs.abstract: A look back at the Numberplay puzzles of 2011.

docs.snippet: A look back at the Numberplay puzzles of 2011....
docs.abstract: A look back at the Numberplay puzzles of 2011.
docs.lead_paragraph: Happy New Year to all Numberplay readers. The New Year is traditionally a time to look back nostalgically at the past year, and look forward with hope toward the coming year. Today, I want to do mostly the former, because puzzles are infinite and open-ended and not even the authors of Numberplay know what the future will bring! But looking back over 2011 there are plenty of treasures that we can revisit, savor and perhaps extend.

headline.main: For Wall Street Overseer, Progress Comes at a Crawl

docs.snippet: After 17 months, a nominee was announced to lead the Office of Financial Research, an agency that has been slow to fill its ranks and meet its deadlines....

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: After 17 months, a nominee was announced to lead the Office of Financial Research, an agency that has been slow to fill its ranks and meet its deadlines.
docs.lead_paragraph: Leading a new federal agency intended to help prevent another financial crisis may seem like a dream job for most economic gurus, but the government made a nomination only last month after a painfully slow search process.
